content.text: Write the number sixteen thousand and sixty-two in figures
Write three-quarters as
(a) a decimal
(b) a percentage
Write down the value of
Measure the length of line \(AB\) in millimetres
Draw a line through point \(P\) that is perpendicular to line \(AB\)
The diagram shows a line \(AB\) and a point \(P\)
Complete this statement
Shade \(\frac{2}{5}\) of the rectangle
Find the value of the reciprocal of \(\frac{1}{3}\)
Write \(2^{-3}\) as a fraction
Put one pair of brackets into each calculation to make it correct
Write these fractions in order, starting with the smallest
Draw a net of the cuboid on the \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Work out the volume of the cuboid
Give the units of your answer
A cuboid has length \(5\mathrm{cm}\) , width \(2\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(3\mathrm{cm}\)
write down the mode
work out the range
work out the median
work out the mean
For these six numbers
Tim has a method for multiplying a number by 99
He shows his method for \(53 \times 99\)
Work out \(85 \times 99\) using Tim's method
A quadrilateral has the geometrical properties
• 4 equal length sides
• 2 lines of symmetry
• rotational symmetry of order 2
Write down the mathematical name of this quadrilateral
Write down two geometrical properties of a rectangle
The parallel sides of a trapezium have lengths \(6\mathrm{cm}\) and \(4\mathrm{cm}\)
The area of the trapezium is \(15\mathrm{cm}^2\)
On the \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid, draw a trapezium with these lengths and area
Complete the table of values for \(y = (x + 3)(x - 2)\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = (x + 3)(x - 2)\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
Write down the coordinates of the lowest point of the graph
Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph
Use your graph to solve the equation \((x + 3)(x - 2) = 3.\)
Beth thinks of a positive number, \(n\)
She squares \(n\) then subtracts 55
The answer is 9
Work out the value of \(n\)
Find the area of triangle \(B\)
Write down the coordinates of point \(P\)
Work out the coordinates of point \(P\) after a translation by the vector \(\left( \begin{array}{c} - 20 \\ 12 \end{array} \right)\)
Draw the image of triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(\quad y = -1.\)
triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(C\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps

By writing each number in the calculation correct to 1 significant figure, find an estimate for the value of
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 66 and 110
\(P\) is a prime number
Write down the value of \(P\) that satisfies the inequality \(13 < P < 19\)

Use set notation to describe the shaded region
Work out \(2\frac{7}{9}\times 1\frac{1}{5}.\)
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form

Complete this statement about the value of \(m\)
Factorise
Expand and simplify
Solve the simultaneous equations
The diagram shows a shape made from two different semicircles, with the same centre
The radius of the large semicircle is \(7\mathrm{cm}\). The radius of the small semicircle is \(4\mathrm{cm}\)
